instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
This board came in already messed up by another repair store, i have orange light, i can feel some warm, but not at the cpu, but another part of the board, not at any component, the warm is like inside the board. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> is shorted, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is shorted 5 ohm to ground, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground too, i have tried removing <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> which relieved <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> short

I have tried removing <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> but <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short still present, injecting <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> will make <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> smoking, but removing <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> will not make the short gone..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> went to L7520/60, really bad news.
Post exact ohm values (not diode mode), after removing <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>/60.
For short on 5V side you should suspect <CAPACITOR>C6412</CAPACITOR>/22/32/42 and the controller chips from the other secondary supplies.
Check all Power FETs from page 63.
On 3V3 side you may have the "chance" for bad SMC, or even CPU...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I would sujest to first, find the short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL>, do not inject voltage there, try to find it in Ohms mode, I've read that you should check the big coils first and that will give you an idea according to the values where the short can be. Then you try and fix <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, at least that's what I would do... Hope to help you in some way...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"removing <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7560</TRANSISTOR> which relieved <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> short"
Pay more atention please...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> resistance to ground is 0.4 kohm
so for 5v should i inject ?
removed smc  but <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> still short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I was expecting you've already done that.
Not too much hope on this board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
yeah actually I have inject voltage before, which result in <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> smoking, and I also feel heat at another part inside the board ( not from the cpu ), maybe the traces is messed up inside the board
I will return this to customer then, thanks..
